trans-unit.source: Publish an app in Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Publish an app in Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Learn how to publish applications and resources in Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to publish applications and resources in Azure RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: How to publish an app in RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: How to publish an app in RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: After you create your RemoteApp collection, you need to publish the apps or resources that you want to make available for your users.
trans-unit.target: After you create your RemoteApp collection, you need to publish the apps or resources that you want to make available for your users.

trans-unit.source: The template images provided with your subscription only have a few apps published by default - to share the other apps, you need to publish them.
trans-unit.target: The template images provided with your subscription only have a few apps published by default - to share the other apps, you need to publish them.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Do you need to update an app?
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Do you need to update an app?

trans-unit.source: You'll need to [update the image](remoteapp-update.md) first.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to [update the image](remoteapp-update.md) first.

trans-unit.source: On the **Publishing** tab in the portal, click **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Publishing** tab in the portal, click **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: You can either add an app from your template image's **Start** menu or provide the path to where the app is installed on the template image.
trans-unit.target: You can either add an app from your template image's **Start** menu or provide the path to where the app is installed on the template image.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to add from the Start menu, choose the app to publish from the list.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to add from the Start menu, choose the app to publish from the list.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to provide the path to the app, enter a name for the app and the path to the app.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to provide the path to the app, enter a name for the app and the path to the app.

trans-unit.source: Use variables in the path - for example, "%systemdrive%" instead of "c:\".
trans-unit.target: Use variables in the path - for example, "%systemdrive%" instead of "c:\".

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to add your app from the **Start** menu, you need to have *added that app to the **Start** menu on your template image.* Otherwise, RemoteApp will only see what *is* on the **Start** menu, and you will be confused.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to add your app from the **Start** menu, you need to have *added that app to the **Start** menu on your template image.* Otherwise, RemoteApp will only see what *is* on the **Start** menu, and you will be confused.

trans-unit.source: If you forgot to add the app to the **Start** menu when you created the template, choose to add the path to the app.
trans-unit.target: If you forgot to add the app to the **Start** menu when you created the template, choose to add the path to the app.

trans-unit.source: (Or recreate your template image, but that's quite a bit more work.)
trans-unit.target: (Or recreate your template image, but that's quite a bit more work.)
